title.narrative: WASH emergency response in Shaidaiee, Herat

description.narrative: Afghanistan is now in the midst of a drought. More than two thirds of the country have been affected and as a result the drought has worsened the availability of drinking water. Existing response capacity is limited and most IDPs have insufficient access to safe drinking water and sanitation facilities with people living in makeshift shelters. The project aims to improve the health and quality of life of drought affected IDPs in Shaidaiee settlement in Injil district in Herat province through provision of safe drinking water to 25,000 IDPs, access to emergency sanitation facilities, providing hygiene consumables and promoting hygiene behavior change. The project is fully aligned with the Afghanistan Humanitarian Response Plan (revised in May 2018), Strategic Objective 3, “People struck by sudden onset crises get the help they need, on time” and responds to the WASH Cluster’s Objectives, the Strategic Advisory Group’s meeting and decision from November 12th, 2018, to continue ongoing WASH responses at IDP sites in Herat under AHF 6th Reserve Allocation. The WASH cluster requested DACAAR to continue much needed WASH services to the ECHO/ERM-8 caseload in Shaidaiee IDP settlement because ECHO’s response will end on December 14th. The project applies an integrated approach to reducing prevalence of water borne diseases by combining hygiene promotion with sanitation and access to safe drinking water. DACAAR will: - provide water by tankering: 12 liters of clean drinking water per person per day for 107 days (until March 31, 2019) for 25,000 individuals, total of 32,100,000 liters - provide 35 new water storage containers (metallic 3,000 liters each) for the increased response of water tankering - install 350 new emergency latrines/baths for existing and new IDPs, serving a cluster of three families of the same extended family/tribe, in line with Sphere standards. Thus, assisting 1,050 families. In case the IDPs in Shaidaiee are forced to move to a different location, DACAAR will install latrines/baths in the new location. - repair existing emergency latrines/baths of IDPS in Shaidaiee. In case the IDPs in Shaidaiee are forced to move to a different location, DACAAR will not repair the existing latrines/baths and instead install additional new latrines/baths in the new location. - provide hygiene consumables 2 times to 3,500 IDP families and in case the need arises for additional hygiene consumable or complete hygiene kits, DACAAR will request those from UNICEF or other partners. - provide hygiene education sessions to 3,500 IDP families.
